It takes 15 minutes for the oven to preheat to 350 degrees. It then takes 20% longer for the oven to preheat to the desired temperature of 425 degrees. After preheating the oven, it takes 10 minutes less time to bake than it took to preheat the oven. How much time passes from starting the oven to having baked a cake?

To preheat the oven to 425 degrees, it takes 15 minutes + 20% of 15 minutes = 18 minutes. So, the total time to preheat the oven is 15 + 18 = 33 minutes. After preheating the oven, it takes 33 - 10 = 23 minutes to bake the cake. Therefore, the total time from starting the oven to having baked a cake is 33 + 23 = 56 minutes.

It takes 25 minutes for the water to boil at 212 degrees. It then takes 30% longer for the water to boil at the desired temperature of 250 degrees. After boiling the water, it takes 8 minutes less time to steep than it took to boil the water. How much time passes from starting the water to having steeped tea?

To boil the water at 250 degrees, it takes 25 minutes + 30% of 25 minutes = 32.5 minutes. So, the total time to boil the water is 25 + 32.5 = 57.5 minutes. After boiling the water, it takes 57.5 - 8 = 49.5 minutes to steep the tea. Therefore, the total time from starting the water to having steeped tea is 57.5 + 49.5 = 107 minutes.

It takes 10 minutes for the rice to cook at 200 degrees. It then takes 50% longer for the rice to cook at the desired temperature of 300 degrees. After cooking the rice, it takes 3 minutes less time to serve than it took to cook the rice. How much time passes from starting the rice to having served it?

To cook the rice at 300 degrees, it takes 10 minutes + 50% of 10 minutes = 15 minutes. So, the total time to cook the rice is 10 + 15 = 25 minutes. After cooking the rice, it takes 25 - 3 = 22 minutes to serve it. Therefore, the total time from starting the rice to having served it is 25 + 22 = 47 minutes.

It takes 30 minutes for the dough to rise at 80 degrees. It then takes 25% longer for the dough to rise at the desired temperature of 100 degrees. After rising the dough, it takes 15 minutes less time to bake than it took to rise the dough. How much time passes from starting the dough to having baked bread?

To rise the dough at 100 degrees, it takes 30 minutes + 25% of 30 minutes = 37.5 minutes. So, the total time to rise the dough is 30 + 37.5 = 67.5 minutes. After rising the dough, it takes 67.5 - 15 = 52.5 minutes to bake the bread. Therefore, the total time from starting the dough to having baked bread is 67.5 + 52.5 = 120 minutes.

It takes 40 minutes for the soup to simmer at 180 degrees. It then takes 20% longer for the soup to simmer at the desired temperature of 220 degrees. After simmering the soup, it takes 12 minutes less time to serve than it took to simmer the soup. How much time passes from starting the soup to having served it?

To simmer the soup at 220 degrees, it takes 40 minutes + 20% of 40 minutes = 48 minutes. So, the total time to simmer the soup is 40 + 48 = 88 minutes. After simmering the soup, it takes 88 - 12 = 76 minutes to serve it. Therefore, the total time from starting the soup to having served it is 88 + 76 = 164 minutes.
A store sells apples for $0.50 each and oranges for $0.75 each. If a customer buys 10 apples and 5 oranges, how much does the customer spend?
The cost of 10 apples is 10 x $0.50 = $5. The cost of 5 oranges is 5 x $0.75 = $3.75. Therefore, the customer spends $5 + $3.75 = $8.75.
A restaurant has a menu with items priced at $10, $15, and $20. If a customer orders 2 items priced at $10, 3 items priced at $15, and 1 item priced at $20, how much does the customer spend?
The cost of 2 items priced at $10 is 2 x $10 = $20. The cost of 3 items priced at $15 is 3 x $15 = $45. The cost of 1 item priced at $20 is $20. Therefore, the customer spends $20 + $45 + $20 = $85.
A company has two types of products: Product A costs $25 and Product B costs $35. If the company sells 10 units of Product A and 5 units of Product B, how much revenue does the company generate?

The revenue generated from selling 10 units of Product A is 10 x $25 = $250. The revenue generated from selling 5 units of Product B is 5 x $35 = $175. Therefore, the company generates $250 + $175 = $425 in revenue.

A school is selling tickets for a fundraising event. Adult tickets cost $20 and student tickets cost $10. If the school sells 50 adult tickets and 100 student tickets, how much money does the school raise?
The money raised from selling 50 adult tickets is 50 x $20 = $1000. The money raised from selling 100 student tickets is 100 x $10 = $1000. Therefore, the school raises $1000 + $1000 = $2000.
A grocery store sells milk for $3 per gallon and bread for $2 per loaf. If a customer buys 2 gallons of milk and 3 loaves of bread, how much does the customer spend?
The cost of 2 gallons of milk is 2 x $3 = $6. The cost of 3 loaves of bread is 3 x $2 = $6. Therefore, the customer spends $6 + $6 = $12.
A baker has 24 cupcakes. One-third of the cupcakes have sprinkles on them, and half of the sprinkled cupcakes have chocolate sprinkles. How many cupcakes have chocolate sprinkles?
One-third of 24 cupcakes is 8 cupcakes. Half of the sprinkled cupcakes (8/2) have chocolate sprinkles. Therefore, there are 4 cupcakes with chocolate sprinkles.
A farmer has 30 chickens. One-fifth of the chickens are roosters, and half of the roosters are white. How many white roosters does the farmer have?
One-fifth of 30 chickens is 6 chickens. Half of the roosters (6/2) are white. Therefore, there are 3 white roosters.
A toy store has 36 stuffed animals. One-fourth of the stuffed animals are bears, and half of the bears are brown. How many brown bears does the toy store have?
One-fourth of 36 stuffed animals is 9 stuffed animals. Half of the bears (9/2) are brown. Therefore, there are 4.5 brown bears. Since we cannot have half a bear, we round down to 4 brown bears.
A classroom has 28 students. One-sixth of the students are left-handed, and half of the left-handed students are girls. How many left-handed girls are in the classroom?

One-sixth of 28 students is 4.67 students. Since we cannot have a fraction of a student, we round up to 5 left-handed students. Half of the left-handed students (5/2) are girls. Therefore, there are 2.5 left-handed girls. Since we cannot have half a student, we round down to 2 left-handed girls.
A zoo has 20 monkeys. One-tenth of the monkeys are babies, and half of the babies are male. How many baby male monkeys are in the zoo?
One-tenth of 20 monkeys is 2 monkeys. Half of the babies (2/2) are male. Therefore, there is 1 baby male monkey.

John buys 4 bags of Skittles. The first bag has 200 Skittles in it. The second bag has 15 more Skittles than the first, the third bag has 10 less Skittles than the second, and the fourth bag has twice the number of Skittles as the first bag. How many Skittles did John get total?
The second bag has 200 + 15 = 215 Skittles.The third bag has 215 - 10 = 205 Skittles.The fourth bag has 2 x 200 = 400 Skittles.John got a total of 200 + 215 + 205 + 400 = 1020 Skittles.

Samantha buys 5 bags of jelly beans. The first bag has 150 jelly beans in it. The second bag has 20 more jelly beans than the first, the third bag has 30 less jelly beans than the second, the fourth bag has twice the number of jelly beans as the third bag, and the fifth bag has half the number of jelly beans as the first bag. How many jelly beans did Samantha get total?

The second bag has 150 + 20 = 170 jelly beans.The third bag has 170 - 30 = 140 jelly beans.The fourth bag has 2 x 140 = 280 jelly beans.The fifth bag has 150 / 2 = 75 jelly beans.Samantha got a total of 150 + 170 + 140 + 280 + 75 = 815 jelly beans.

Tom buys 6 bags of gummy bears. The first bag has 100 gummy bears in it. The second bag has 25 more gummy bears than the first, the third bag has 10 less gummy bears than the second, the fourth bag has three times the number of gummy bears as the third bag, the fifth bag has half the number of gummy bears as the fourth bag, and the sixth bag has twice the number of gummy bears as the first bag. How many gummy bears did Tom get total?

The second bag has 100 + 25 = 125 gummy bears.The third bag has 125 - 10 = 115 gummy bears.The fourth bag has 3 x 115 = 345 gummy bears.The fifth bag has 345 / 2 = 172.5, which rounds up to 173 gummy bears.The sixth bag has 2 x 100 = 200 gummy bears.Tom got a total of 100 + 125 + 115 + 345 + 173 + 200 = 1058 gummy bears.

Emily buys 3 bags of Hershey's Kisses. The first bag has 250 Hershey's Kisses in it. The second bag has 30 more Hershey's Kisses than the first, and the third bag has half the number of Hershey's Kisses as the second bag. How many Hershey's Kisses did Emily get total?
The second bag has 250 + 30 = 280 Hershey's Kisses.The third bag has 280 / 2 = 140 Hershey's Kisses.Emily got a total of 250 + 280 + 140 = 670 Hershey's Kisses.

David buys 4 bags of Reese's Pieces. The first bag has 180 Reese's Pieces in it. The second bag has 20 more Reese's Pieces than the first, the third bag has 10 less Reese's Pieces than the second, and the fourth bag has twice the number of Reese's Pieces as the third bag. How many Reese's Pieces did David get total?

The second bag has 180 + 20 = 200 Reese's Pieces.The third bag has 200 - 10 = 190 Reese's Pieces.The fourth bag has 2 x 190 = 380 Reese's Pieces.David got a total of 180 + 200 + 190 + 380 = 950 Reese's Pieces.

Samantha has 3 apartments with 2 bedrooms each. Each bedroom has 1 closet each. There are an additional 2 closets in each apartment not connected to bedrooms. How many total closets are there between the apartments?

There are 3 apartments with 2 bedrooms each, so there are a total of 3 x 2 = 6 bedrooms. Each bedroom has 1 closet, so there are a total of 6 x 1 = 6 closets in the bedrooms. There are also 2 closets in each apartment not connected to bedrooms, so there are a total of 3 x 2 = 6 additional closets. Therefore, there are a total of 6 + 6 = 12 closets between the apartments.
Tom has 4 cars with 5 seats each. Each seat has 1 seatbelt. There are an additional 2 seatbelts in each car not connected to seats. How many total seatbelts are there between the cars?

There are 4 cars with 5 seats each, so there are a total of 4 x 5 = 20 seats. Each seat has 1 seatbelt, so there are a total of 20 x 1 = 20 seatbelts in the seats. There are also 2 seatbelts in each car not connected to seats, so there are a total of 4 x 2 = 8 additional seatbelts. Therefore, there are a total of 20 + 8 = 28 seatbelts between the cars.
Emily has 2 dogs with 4 legs each. Each leg has 3 toes. There are an additional 2 toes on each dog not connected to legs. How many total toes are there between the dogs?

There are 2 dogs with 4 legs each, so there are a total of 2 x 4 = 8 legs. Each leg has 3 toes, so there are a total of 8 x 3 = 24 toes on the legs. There are also 2 toes on each dog not connected to legs, so there are a total of 2 x 2 = 4 additional toes. Therefore, there are a total of 24 + 4 = 28 toes between the dogs.

David has 5 backpacks with 2 pockets each. Each pocket has 1 zipper. There are an additional 3 zippers on each backpack not connected to pockets. How many total zippers are there between the backpacks?

There are 5 backpacks with 2 pockets each, so there are a total of 5 x 2 = 10 pockets. Each pocket has 1 zipper, so there are a total of 10 x 1 = 10 zippers on the pockets. There are also 3 zippers on each backpack not connected to pockets, so there are a total of 5 x 3 = 15 additional zippers. Therefore, there are a total of 10 + 15 = 25 zippers between the backpacks.
Liam has 3 bikes with 2 wheels each. Each wheel has 10 spokes. There are an additional 4 spokes on each bike not connected to wheels. How many total spokes are there between the bikes?

There are 3 bikes with 2 wheels each, so there are a total of 3 x 2 = 6 wheels. Each wheel has 10 spokes, so there are a total of 6 x 10 = 60 spokes on the wheels. There are also 4 spokes on each bike not connected to wheels, so there are a total of 3 x 4 = 12 additional spokes. Therefore, there are a total of 60 + 12 = 72 spokes between the bikes.
A father goes to the grocery store and buys a carton of eggs for $2.50, a loaf of bread for $3.75, and a gallon of milk for $4.20. If he pays with a $20 bill, how much change does he receive?
The total cost of the items is $2.50 + $3.75 + $4.20 = $10.45. To find the change, we subtract the total cost from the amount paid: $20 - $10.45 = $9.55.
A student goes to the bookstore and buys a notebook for $1.50, a pen for $0.75, and a textbook for $12.25. If the student pays with a $20 bill, how much change does he receive?
The total cost of the items is $1.50 + $0.75 + $12.25 = $14.50. To find the change, we subtract the total cost from the amount paid: $20 - $14.50 = $5.50.
A customer goes to a coffee shop and buys a latte for $3.50, a croissant for $2.25, and a muffin for $1.75. If the customer pays with a $10 bill, how much change does he receive?
The total cost of the items is $3.50 + $2.25 + $1.75 = $7.50. To find the change, we subtract the total cost from the amount paid: $10 - $7.50 = $2.50.
A family goes to a restaurant and orders a pizza for $12.50, a salad for $6.75, and a soda for $2.25. If they pay with a $20 bill, how much change do they receive?

The total cost of the items is $12.50 + $6.75 + $2.25 = $21.50. To find the change, we subtract the total cost from the amount paid: $20 - $21.50 = -$1.50. Since they paid less than the total cost, they do not receive any change.
A group of friends goes to a movie theater and buys tickets for $8.50 each. If they pay with a $50 bill, how much change do they receive?

The total cost of the tickets is $8.50 x number of friends. Let's say there are 4 friends, so the total cost is $8.50 x 4 = $34. To find the change, we subtract the total cost from the amount paid: $50 - $34 = $16.
A recipe for 12 muffins calls for 2 cups of flour. If a recipe for 24 muffins is desired, how many cups of flour are needed?

To find out how much flour is needed for 24 muffins, we can use a proportion. If 12 muffins require 2 cups of flour, then 1 muffin requires 2/12 = 1/6 cups of flour. Therefore, 24 muffins require (1/6) x 24 = 4 cups of flour.
A car travels 240 miles in 4 hours. How many miles will it travel in 7 hours?

To find out how many miles the car will travel in 7 hours, we can use a proportion. If the car travels 240 miles in 4 hours, then it travels 240/4 = 60 miles per hour. Therefore, in 7 hours, the car will travel 60 x 7 = 420 miles.
A rectangular garden has a length of 12 feet and a width of 8 feet. What is the area of the garden?
The area of a rectangle is found by multiplying its length by its width. Therefore, the area of the garden is 12 x 8 = 96 square feet.
A recipe for 6 servings calls for 1/2 cup of sugar. How much sugar is needed for 9 servings?

To find out how much sugar is needed for 9 servings, we can use a proportion. If 6 servings require 1/2 cup of sugar, then 1 serving requires 1/2 x 1/6 = 1/12 cups of sugar. Therefore, 9 servings require (1/12) x 9 = 3/4 cups of sugar.
A store sells 3 shirts for $30. How much would 5 shirts cost?
To find out how much 5 shirts would cost, we can use a proportion. If 3 shirts cost $30, then 1 shirt costs $10. Therefore, 5 shirts would cost 5 x $10 = $50.

Mr. Smith wants to buy 15 packets of carrot seeds and 10 packets of cucumber seeds for his garden. If a packet of carrot seeds costs $25 and a packet of cucumber seeds costs $20, how much money will he spend on the seeds?
The cost of 15 packets of carrot seeds is 15 x $25 = $375. The cost of 10 packets of cucumber seeds is 10 x $20 = $200. Therefore, the total cost of the seeds is $375 + $200 = $575.

Mrs. Johnson wants to plant 30 packets of sunflower seeds and 50 packets of pumpkin seeds in her garden. If a packet of sunflower seeds costs $15 and a packet of pumpkin seeds costs $35, how much money will she spend on the seeds?
The cost of 30 packets of sunflower seeds is 30 x $15 = $450. The cost of 50 packets of pumpkin seeds is 50 x $35 = $1750. Therefore, the total cost of the seeds is $450 + $1750 = $2200.

Mr. Brown wants to buy 25 packets of watermelon seeds and 40 packets of cantaloupe seeds for his farm. If a packet of watermelon seeds costs $50 and a packet of cantaloupe seeds costs $30, how much money will he spend on the seeds?
The cost of 25 packets of watermelon seeds is 25 x $50 = $1250. The cost of 40 packets of cantaloupe seeds is 40 x $30 = $1200. Therefore, the total cost of the seeds is $1250 + $1200 = $2450.

Mrs. Lee wants to plant 20 packets of lettuce seeds and 30 packets of spinach seeds in her garden. If a packet of lettuce seeds costs $10 and a packet of spinach seeds costs $15, how much money will she spend on the seeds?
The cost of 20 packets of lettuce seeds is 20 x $10 = $200. The cost of 30 packets of spinach seeds is 30 x $15 = $450. Therefore, the total cost of the seeds is $200 + $450 = $650.

Mr. Davis wants to buy 35 packets of corn seeds and 15 packets of bean seeds for his farm. If a packet of corn seeds costs $30 and a packet of bean seeds costs $25, how much money will he spend on the seeds?
The cost of 35 packets of corn seeds is 35 x $30 = $1050. The cost of 15 packets of bean seeds is 15 x $25 = $375. Therefore, the total cost of the seeds is $1050 + $375 = $1425.

A restaurant offers a three-course meal deal. The first course has 5 options, the second course has 8 options, and the third course has 3 options. If a customer chooses one option from each course, how many different meal combinations are possible?
To find the total number of meal combinations, we need to multiply the number of options for each course. So, 5 x 8 x 3 = 120.
A company has 6 employees who need to be assigned to 4 different projects. Each project needs exactly 2 employees. How many different ways can the employees be assigned to the projects?

We can use the combination formula to find the number of ways to choose 2 employees out of 6. So, the number of ways to assign employees to the first project is 6C2 = 15. Once two employees are assigned to the first project, there are 4 employees left to choose from for the second project, which gives us 4C2 = 6 ways to assign employees to the second project. Similarly, there are 2C2 = 1 ways to assign employees to the third project and only one way to assign employees to the fourth project. To find the total number of ways to assign employees to the projects, we need to multiply these numbers together: 15 x 6 x 1 x 1 = 90.
A store is having a sale where all items are 20% off. If a shirt originally costs $25, what is the sale price?
To find the sale price, we need to multiply the original price by the discount percentage (in decimal form): $25 x 0.2 = $5. Then, we subtract the discount from the original price: $25 - $5 = $20.
A school has 4 math classes, each with 25 students. If each student needs a calculator for class, how many calculators does the school need to purchase?
To find the total number of calculators needed, we need to multiply the number of students in each class by the number of classes: 25 x 4 = 100.
A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour, 1 cup of sugar, and 3 eggs. If you want to make half of the recipe, how much flour do you need?
To make half of the recipe, we need to divide each ingredient by 2. So, we need 1 cup of flour (2 cups ÷ 2 = 1 cup).

Carly had 60 cards, 3/5 of the cards had the letter A on them, 1/3 of the remaining had the letter B, 1/4 of the rest had the letter C on them, and the others had the letter D. How many of the cards had the letter D on them?

Number of cards with letter A = 60 x 3/5 = 36Number of remaining cards = 60 - 36 = 24Number of cards with letter B = 24 x 1/3 = 8Number of remaining cards = 24 - 8 = 16Number of cards with letter C = 16 x 1/4 = 4Number of cards with letter D = 16 - 4 = 12

Sarah had 120 cards, 1/4 of the cards had the letter A on them, 1/3 of the remaining had the letter B, 1/2 of the rest had the letter C on them, and the others had the letter D. How many of the cards had the letter D on them?

Number of cards with letter A = 120 x 1/4 = 30Number of remaining cards = 120 - 30 = 90Number of cards with letter B = 90 x 1/3 = 30Number of remaining cards = 90 - 30 = 60Number of cards with letter C = 60 x 1/2 = 30Number of cards with letter D = 60 - 30 = 30

Tom had 80 cards, 2/5 of the cards had the letter A on them, 1/4 of the remaining had the letter B, 3/5 of the rest had the letter C on them, and the others had the letter D. How many of the cards had the letter D on them?

Number of cards with letter A = 80 x 2/5 = 32Number of remaining cards = 80 - 32 = 48Number of cards with letter B = 48 x 1/4 = 12Number of remaining cards = 48 - 12 = 36Number of cards with letter C = 36 x 3/5 = 21.6 (rounded to 22)Number of cards with letter D = 36 - 22 = 14

Lisa had 100 cards, 1/2 of the cards had the letter A on them, 1/3 of the remaining had the letter B, 2/5 of the rest had the letter C on them, and the others had the letter D. How many of the cards had the letter D on them?

Number of cards with letter A = 100 x 1/2 = 50Number of remaining cards = 100 - 50 = 50Number of cards with letter B = 50 x 1/3 = 16.67 (rounded to 17)Number of remaining cards = 50 - 17 = 33Number of cards with letter C = 33 x 2/5 = 13.2 (rounded to 13)Number of cards with letter D = 33 - 13 = 20
It takes Sarah 5 minutes to wash a small car and 15 minutes to wash a large car. How many hours will it take her to wash 20 small cars and 10 large cars?

To wash 1 small car, Sarah takes 5 minutes. To wash 20 small cars, she will take 20 x 5 = 100 minutes. To wash 1 large car, Sarah takes 15 minutes. To wash 10 large cars, she will take 10 x 15 = 150 minutes. Therefore, the total time taken by Sarah to wash 20 small cars and 10 large cars is 100 + 150 = 250 minutes. To convert minutes to hours, we divide by 60. So, the answer is 250/60 = 4.17 hours.
It takes John 2 minutes to make a small sandwich and 5 minutes to make a large sandwich. How many hours will it take him to make 25 small sandwiches and 15 large sandwiches?

To make 1 small sandwich, John takes 2 minutes. To make 25 small sandwiches, he will take 25 x 2 = 50 minutes. To make 1 large sandwich, John takes 5 minutes. To make 15 large sandwiches, he will take 15 x 5 = 75 minutes. Therefore, the total time taken by John to make 25 small sandwiches and 15 large sandwiches is 50 + 75 = 125 minutes. To convert minutes to hours, we divide by 60. So, the answer is 125/60 = 2.08 hours.

To clean 1 small room, Emily takes 4 minutes. To clean 30 small rooms, she will take 30 x 4 = 120 minutes. To clean 1 large room, Emily takes 12 minutes. Mico and Marco wanted to get to know each other. They realized that the sum of their ages is 20. What will be the sum of their ages in 10 years?

Let's assume Mico's age is x and Marco's age is y. According to the problem, x + y = 20. In 10 years, Mico's age will be x + 10 and Marco's age will be y + 10. John is 4 years older than Mary. In 5 years, John will be twice as old as Mary. How old is Mary now?
Let's assume Mary's age to be x. Then John's age will be x+4. In 5 years, Mary's age will be x+5 and John's age will be x+9. According to the problem, x+9=2(x+5). Solving this equation, we get x=1.
Tom is 3 times older than Jerry. In 7 years, Tom will be twice as old as Jerry. How old is Jerry now?
Let's assume Jerry's age to be x. Then Tom's age will be 3x. In 7 years, Jerry's age will be x+7 and Tom's age will be 3x+7. According to the problem, 3x+7=2(x+7). Solving this equation, we get x=7.
Sarah is 5 years older than David. In 8 years, Sarah will be 3 times as old as David. How old is David now?

John bought 15 pencils at $0.20 each and 5 pens at $0.50 each. How much did he spend in total in dollars?

A zebra has 16 stripes on its body, which is 4 times the number of stripes on a donkey. If there are 20 zebras and 30 donkeys in a zoo, what is one-third of the total number of stripes they have combined?

The number of stripes on a donkey is 16/4 = 4. Therefore, the total number of stripes on 20 zebras is 20 x 16 = 320, and the total number of stripes on 30 donkeys is 30 x 4 = 120. The combined total number of stripes is 320 + 120 = 440. One-third of 440 is 440/3 = 146.67, which can be rounded down to 146.
A kangaroo can jump 30 feet in one leap, which is 3 times the distance a rabbit can jump. If there are 25 kangaroos and 50 rabbits in a park, what is half the total distance they can jump combined?

The distance a rabbit can jump is 30/3 = 10 feet. Therefore, the total distance the kangaroos can jump is 25 x 30 = 750 feet, and the total distance the rabbits can jump is 50 x 10 = 500 feet. The combined total distance they can jump is 750 + 500 = 1250 feet. Half of 1250 is 625.

A maple tree has 100 leaves, which is 5 times the number of leaves on a birch tree. If there are 30 maple trees and 60 birch trees in a forest, what is one-fourth of the total number of leaves they have combined?

The number of leaves on a birch tree is 100/5 = 20. Therefore, the total number of leaves on 30 maple trees is 30 x 100 = 3000, and the total number of leaves on 60 birch trees is 60 x 20 = 1200. The combined total number of leaves is 3000 + 1200 = 4200. One-fourth of 4200 is 4200/4 = 1050.

A dolphin can swim at a speed of 40 miles per hour, which is twice the speed of a seal. If there are 15 dolphins and 30 seals in an aquarium, what is one-fifth of the total distance they can swim combined in 2 hours?

The speed of a seal is 40/2 = 20 miles per hour. Therefore, the total distance the dolphins can swim in 2 hours is 15 x 40 x 2 = 1200 miles, and the total distance the seals can swim in 2 hours is 30 x 20 x 2 = 1200 miles. The combined total distance they can swim in 2 hours is 1200 + 1200 = 2400 miles. One-fifth of 2400 is 2400/5 = 480.

A rose bush has 50 flowers, which is 10 times the number of flowers on a daisy plant. If there are 40 rose bushes and 80 daisy plants in a garden, what is one-sixth of the total number of flowers they have combined?

The number of flowers on a daisy plant is 50/10 = 5. Therefore, the total number of flowers on 40 rose bushes is 40 x 50 = 2000, and the total number of flowers on 80 daisy plants is 80 x 5 = 400. The combined total number of flowers is 2000 + 400 = 2400. One-sixth of 2400 is 2400/6 = 400.

The number of guests is 10 x 3 = 30. The total number of people is 10 + 2 + 30 = 42. The number of pizzas needed is 42 / 4 = 10.5, which rounds up to 11. The cost of 11 pizzas is 11 x $20 = $220.

A group of friends went to a restaurant and ordered different meals. John ordered 3 plates of rice and 2 plates of chicken, while Mary ordered 4 plates of rice and 1 plate of chicken. If each plate of rice cost $5 and each plate of chicken cost $8, what was the total cost of their meals?

To find the total cost of their meals, we need to calculate the cost of John's meals and Mary's meals separately, then add them together. A school has 300 students. If 60% of the students are girls, how many boys are there in the school?

A 64-star flag has four rows of 8 stars and the rest are 4-star rows. How many rows of 4 stars are there altogether on the flag?

There are 4 rows of 8 stars, which means there are 4 x 8 = 32 stars in those rows. The flag has a total of 64 stars, so there must be 64 - 32 = 32 stars in the remaining rows. Since each row has 4 stars, there are 32 / 4 = 8 rows of 4 stars on the flag.

A car in the fast lane is traveling at 70 miles/hour. A car in the slow lane is traveling at half that speed. If the car in the fast lane traveled for a total of 420 miles, calculate the time the car in the slow lane took to cover the same distance?

The car in the fast lane traveled for a total of 420 miles at a speed of 70 miles/hour. Therefore, the time taken by the car in the fast lane is 420/70 = 6 hours. The car in the slow lane is traveling at half the speed of the car in the fast lane, which is 70/2 = 35 miles/hour. Samantha has 15 apples and she wants to divide them equally among her 3 friends. How many apples will each friend get?

6 adults and 12 children are to share 10 packets of candy. Each packet contains 8 candies. If each adult gets 4 candies and the rest are to be shared equally among the children, how many will each child get?

Total number of candies = 10 packets x 8 candies/packet = 80 candiesNumber of candies for adults = 6 adults x 4 candies/adult = 24 candiesNumber of candies for children = 80 candies - 24 candies = 56 candiesNumber of children = 12 childrenNumber of candies per child = 56 candies / 12 children = 4.67 candies/childRounding down to the nearest integer, each child will get 4 candies.

5 adults and 10 children are to share 12 packets of chips. Each packet contains 6 chips. If each adult gets 4 chips and the rest are to be shared equally among the children, how many will each child get?

John earns $8 every 15 minutes for a task he does. If he works between 9 a.m. and 12 p.m. and pauses in between for 20 minutes, how much money does he earn for the task?

Three friends: Sarah, Emily, and Lily decided to play a game. After 2 rounds Sarah has 12 points, Emily 2 points less than Sarah, and Lily 3 times more than Sarah. In the third round, every player gets an extra point if they have over 10 points. How many points do all three players have in total after the extra points had been distributed?

Sarah has 12 points, Emily has 10 points (2 less than Sarah), and Lily has 36 points (3 times more than Sarah). Since all three players have over 10 points, they each get an extra point. Will buys 15 oranges. When he gets home, he asks his 2 sons to wash as many oranges as they are years old. The oldest son is 8 years old, the youngest is half as old as the oldest. How many oranges are left unwashed?

The oldest son is 8 years old, so he washes 8 oranges. The youngest son is half as old as the oldest, so he is 4 years old and washes 4 oranges. Therefore, the total number of oranges washed is 8 + 4 = 12. The number of oranges left unwashed is 15 - 12 = 3.
John has 20 marbles. He gives his friend 3 marbles and keeps 2 marbles for himself. How many marbles does John have left?
John gives his friend 3 marbles, so he has 20 - 3 = 17 marbles. He keeps 2 marbles for himself, so he has 17 - 2 = 15 marbles left.

On Monday, John ran 2 miles, did 30 pushups, and 20 sit-ups. On Tuesday, he ran 1 mile more than on Monday, did 10 more pushups, and 5 more sit-ups. How many miles did John run and how many exercises did he do in total?
On Tuesday, John ran 2 + 1 = 3 miles, did 30 + 10 = 40 pushups, and 20 + 5 = 25 sit-ups. In total, John ran 2 + 3 = 5 miles and did 30 + 40 = 70 pushups and 20 + 25 = 45 sit-ups.

Each person in a certain household consumes 0.2 kg of rice every meal. Supposing 5 members of the household eat rice every lunch and dinner, how many weeks will a 42 kg bag of rice last?

First, we need to find out how much rice is consumed per day by the household. Since there are 5 members and they eat rice twice a day, the total rice consumption per day is 5 x 0.2 kg x 2 = 2 kg. To find out how many days the 42 kg bag of rice will last, we divide 42 by 2, which gives us 21 days. Therefore, the bag of rice will last for 3 weeks.
A car travels at a speed of 60 km/h. How long will it take to travel a distance of 240 km?
To find out the time taken to travel a distance, we use the formula: time = distance / speed. Substituting the given values, we get time = 240 / 60 = 4 hours.
A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour to make 12 cookies. How many cups of flour are needed to make 36 cookies?

We can use the concept of proportionality to solve this problem. If 2 cups of flour are needed to make 12 cookies, then 1 cup of flour is needed to make 6 cookies. Therefore, to make 36 cookies, we need 6 cups of flour (6 x 6 = 36).

The area of a rectangle is given by the formula: area = length x width. Substituting the given values, we get area = 12 x 8 = 96 square meters.

To find the discounted price, we first need to find out the amount of discount. The discount is 20% of the original price, which is 0.2 x 25 = $5. Therefore, the discounted price is $25 - $5 = $20.

Samantha goes to an auction to win a painting. She accepts the opening bid of $150 and continues bidding until she wins. The bids on the painting rise by $25 each time and 2 other people each bid once. Samantha bids after each of the 2 other people and eventually wins. How much money, in dollars, does the painting cost her?

The first bid was $150. The bids on the painting rise by $25 each time, so the second bid is $150 + $25 = $175. The third bid is $175 + $25 = $200. The fourth bid is $200 + $25 = $225. Therefore, the painting costs Samantha $300.

Samantha hires a cleaning service to clean her house every other week. Her house is 2,500 square feet and the cleaning service charges $0.15 per square foot. Additionally, Samantha gives the cleaning service a $50 tip each time they come. How much does she pay for cleaning in a year?

To find out how much Samantha pays for cleaning in a year, we need to first calculate how much she pays per cleaning. To do this, we multiply the square footage of her house by the cost per square foot: 2,500 x $0.15 = $375. Then we add the $50 tip: $375 + $50 = $425 per cleaning. Since the cleaning service comes every other week, Samantha pays for 26 cleanings in a year. Liam had $80 in his wallet. He spent 3/4 of it on a new video game and the rest on a movie ticket. How much money did he spend on the video game?
Liam spent 3/4 of $80 on the video game, which is (3/4) x $80 = $60. He spent the remaining money on a movie ticket, which is $80 - $60 = $20.

Samantha works 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, so she works a total of 48 hours per week. If she earns $12 per hour, her weekly salary would be 48 x $12 = $576. A store has 80 shirts in stock. If 3/5 of the shirts are sold on Monday and half of the remaining shirts are sold on Tuesday, how many shirts are left in stock after Tuesday?

On Monday, 3/5 x 80 = 48 shirts are sold. So, 80 - 48 = 32 shirts are left. On Tuesday, half of the remaining shirts are sold, which is 1/2 x 32 = 16 shirts. Therefore, there are 32 - 16 = 16 shirts left in stock after Tuesday.

If it takes 6 hours for 4 workers to complete a project, how many hours will it take for 3 workers to complete the same project?

Let's assume that the amount of work required to complete the project is W. Then, the rate of work of 4 workers is 4W/6 = 2W/3 per hour. A shirt originally priced at $35 is now on sale for $28. A pair of pants originally priced at $50 is now on sale for $40. If you buy 2 shirts and 3 pairs of pants, how much will you save?

The discount on the shirt is $35 - $28 = $7. The discount on the pants is $50 - $40 = $10. So, the total discount on 2 shirts is 2 x $7 = $14 and the total discount on 3 pants is 3 x $10 = $30. Therefore, the total amount saved is $14 + $30 = $44.

A basketball team has 90 members. There are three times as many players on the offense as there are on the defense. There is one-fourth the number of players on the bench as there are on the defense. How many players are on the defense?

Let x be the number of players on the defense. Then, there are 3x players on the offense and x/4 players on the bench. The total number of players is x + 3x + x/4 = 90. Simplifying the equation, we get 13x/4 = 90. Solving for x, we get x = 24.

Samantha is considering two job offers. Job A pays $20 an hour for 1500 hours a year, and is in a state with a 25% total tax rate. Job B pays $35,000 a year and is in a state that charges $5,000 in property tax and a 15% tax rate on net income after property tax. How much more money will Samantha make at the job with a higher net pay rate, compared to the other job?

To calculate the net pay rate for Job A, we first need to calculate the total tax amount. Total tax amount = $20 x 1500 hours x 0.25 = $7,500. So, the net pay for Job A is $20 x 1500 hours - $7,500 = $22,500. To calculate the net pay rate for Job B, we first need to calculate the net income after property tax. Maria buys 8 shares of a stock for $8 each. The stock price increases 50% the first year Maria holds it, then decreases 25% in the second year. What is the final value of all Maria's shares?

A class of 150 students is split into 3 groups such that 2 of them are equal in number and the last one (which is the smallest) is 5 less than each of the other groups. How many students are in this (smallest) group?

Let x be the number of students in each of the two equal groups. Then the number of students in the smallest group is x - 5. The total number of students is x + x + (x - 5) = 3x - 5. Since there are 150 students in total, we have 3x - 5 = 150. Solving for x, we get x = 51. Therefore, the smallest group has 46 students.

Samantha is planning a road trip. She spends 8 hours driving and half that time hiking. She also stops at 4 different restaurants, each for 1 hour. This was 20% of the time she spent. She spent 30% of her time visiting tourist attractions. How much time did she spend visiting tourist attractions?

Let's start by finding out how much time Samantha spent on hiking. Samantha earns $12 per hour at her first job and works for 30 hours, so she earns 12 x 30 = $<<12*30=360>>360.She earns $8 per hour at her second job and works for 20 hours, so she earns 8 x 20 = $<<8*20=160>>160.Therefore, Samantha earns a total of 360 + 160 = $<<360+160=520>>520.She already has $200 in her savings, so she still needs to save 800 - 520 - 200 = $<<800-520-200=80>>80.

There are four boxes of apples. The first box has 10 apples, and the second box has 3 more apples than the first box. The third box has 5 fewer apples than the second box, and the fourth box has twice the number of apples in the third box. How many apples are in the fourth box?

Let's start by finding the number of apples in the second box. Since the second box has 3 more apples than the first box, it has 10 + 3 = 13 apples. The third box has 5 fewer apples than the second box, so it has 13 - 5 = 8 apples. Finally, the fourth box has twice the number of apples in the third box, so it has 8 x 2 = 16 apples.

There are five students in a group. The first student has 3 pencils, and the second student has 2 more pencils than the first student. The third student has 4 fewer pencils than the second student, and the fourth student has twice the number of pencils in the third student. How many pencils does the fifth student need to have to make the total number of pencils in the group 30?

Let's start by finding the number of pencils in the second student's possession. Since the second student has 2 more pencils than the first student, they have 3 + 2 = 5 pencils. The third student has 4 fewer pencils than the second student, so they have 5 - 4 = 1 pencil. The fourth student has twice the number of pencils in the third student, so they have 1 x 2 = 2 pencils. To find the number of pencils the fifth student needs to have, we can subtract the total number of pencils in the group from the sum of the pencils the first four students have: 3 + 5 + 1 + 2 = 11. Therefore, the fifth student needs to have 30 - 11 = 19 pencils.

There are six books on a shelf. The first book has 100 pages, and the second book has 20 more pages than the first book. The third book has 50 fewer pages than the second book, and the fourth book has twice the number of pages in the third book. How many pages are in the sixth book if the total number of pages in all six books is 1000?

Let's start by finding the number of pages in the second book. Since the second book has 20 more pages than the first book, it has 100 + 20 = 120 pages. The third book has 50 fewer pages than the second book, so it has 120 - 50 = 70 pages. Finally, the fourth book has twice the number of pages in the third book, so it has 70 x 2 = 140 pages. To find the number of pages in the sixth book, we can subtract the total number of pages in the first five books from the total number of pages in all six books: 1000 - (100 + 120 + 70 + 140) = 570 pages.

There are seven cars in a parking lot. The first car has 4 doors, and the second car has 2 more doors than the first car. The third car has 1 fewer door than the second car, and the fourth car has twice the number of doors in the third car. How many doors are in the seventh car if the total number of doors in all seven cars is 34?

Let's start by finding the number of doors in the second car. Since the second car has 2 more doors than the first car, it has 4 + 2 = 6 doors. The third car has 1 fewer door than the second car, so it has 6 - 1 = 5 doors. Finally, the fourth car has twice the number of doors in the third car, so it has 5 x 2 = 10 doors. To find the number of doors in the seventh car, we can subtract the total number of doors in the first six cars from the total number of doors in all seven cars: 34 - (4 + 6 + 5 + 10) = 9 doors.

How many pencils does each of the remaining four students need to have to make the total number of pencils in the class 30?

A train travels between 4 different cities. It goes 60 miles from the first city to the second city, 90 miles from the second city to the third city, 120 miles from the third city to the fourth city, and 30 miles less than that combined distance to go from the fourth city to the first city. It does this trip 4 times a day. The train needs service every 20,000 miles so how many days does it go between services?

The total distance traveled by the train in one trip is 60 + 90 + 120 + (210 - 30) = 450 miles. The total distance traveled by the train in one day is 450 x 3 = 1350 miles. The train needs service every 18,000 miles, so it can make 18,000/1350 = 13.33 trips before needing service. Since the train makes 4 trips a day, it can go 13.33/4 = 3.33 days between services. Rounded down, the answer is 3 days.

A truck travels between 5 different cities. It goes 80 miles from the first city to the second city, 120 miles from the second city to the third city, 150 miles from the third city to the fourth city, 200 miles from the fourth city to the fifth city, and 50 miles less than that combined distance to go from the fifth city to the first city. It does this trip 2 times a day. The truck needs service every 25,000 miles so how many days does it go between services?

The total distance traveled by the truck in one trip is 80 + 120 + 150 + 200 + (550 - 50) = 1050 miles. The total distance traveled by the truck in one day is 1050 x 2 = 2100 miles. The truck needs service every 25,000 miles, so it can make 25,000/2100 = 11.90 trips before needing service. Since the truck makes 2 trips a day, it can go 11.90/2 = 5.95 days between services. Rounded down, the answer is 5 days.

The total distance traveled by the bus in one trip is 50 + (50 - 20) = 80 miles. The total distance traveled by the bus in one day is 80 x 5 = 400 miles. The bus needs service every 10,000 miles, so it can make 10,000/400 = 25 trips before needing service. Since the bus makes 5 trips a day, it can go 25/5 = 5 days between services.

Rounded down, the answer is 1 day.

A van travels between 4 different cities. Samantha drives to her grandmother's house 150 miles away. She drives at a speed of 60 mph. She had to take a detour that added 20 miles to her trip. After she gets there she takes a route home that is 180 miles but she goes 70 mph. How long did the trip take?

To find the total time of the trip, we need to find the time it took to get to her grandmother's house and the time it took to get back home. Time to get to grandmother's house = distance/speed = (150+20)/60 = 2.5 hoursTime to get back home = distance/speed = 180/70 = 2.57 hoursTotal time of the trip = 2.5 + 2.57 = 5.07 hours

There are 96 fourth-graders at Small Tree School. 43 of them are girls. On Friday, 5 fourth-grade girls and 4 fourth-grade boys were absent. How many fourth grade boys were at Small Tree School on Friday?

The total number of fourth-grade boys and girls at Small Tree School is 96. Out of these, 43 are girls. So, the number of boys is 96 - 43 = 53. On Friday, 5 fourth-grade girls were absent. So, the number of fourth-grade girls present on Friday is 43 - 5 = 38. Similarly, 4 fourth-grade boys were absent. So, the number of fourth-grade boys present on Friday is 53 - 4 = 49.

To be promoted to the next school year, John takes 4 tests that together must total at least 60 points. On his first test, John scored 12 points, on the second test he scored 18 points, and on the third test he scored 20 points. What is the minimum number of points he must score on the fourth test to pass?

5 students were absent from school on Monday. The number of absent students on Tuesday was twice that of Monday. On Wednesday, the number of absent students was three times that of Monday. If a total of 24 students were absent for the three days, how many were absent on Monday?

Let x be the number of students absent on Monday. Then, the number of absent students on Tuesday is 2x and the number of absent students on Wednesday is 3x. The total number of absent students for the three days is x + 2x + 3x = 6x. Since the total number of absent students for the three days is 24, we have 6x = 24, which gives x = 4. Therefore, 4 students were absent on Monday.

A company produces 1000 units of a product per day. The number of units produced on Tuesday is 20% more than that of Monday. On Wednesday, the number of units produced is 10% less than that of Tuesday. If a total of 2700 units were produced for the three days, how many units were produced on Monday?

Let x be the number of units produced on Monday. Then, the number of units produced on Tuesday is 1.2x and the number of units produced on Wednesday is 0.9(1.2x) = 1.08x. The total number of units produced for the three days is x + 1.2x + 1.08x = 3.28x. Since the total number of units produced for the three days is 2700, we have 3.28x = 2700, which gives x = 823.17 (rounded to the nearest integer). Therefore, 823 units were produced on Monday.

If a total of 500 products were sold for the two days for product A, how many products of type A were sold on Sunday?

Let x be the number of products of type A sold on Sunday. Then, the number of products of type A sold on Monday is 1.1x and the number of products of type A sold on Tuesday is 0.8(1.1x) = 0.88x. Since the total number of products of type A sold for the two days is 500, we have x + 0.88x = 500, which gives x = 312.5 (rounded to the nearest integer). Therefore, 312 products of type A were sold on Sunday.

After scoring 12 points, John now has twice as many points as Mark, who scored 6. How many points did John have before?

Let's assume that John had x points before. We know that John scored 12 points, so his total points now are x + 12. We also know that Mark scored 6 points, so John has twice as many points as Mark, which means x + 12 = 2(6) + x. Solving for x, we get x = 6.

John borrowed $2,500 for four months at an interest rate of 8%. He has to pay an equal amount every month. How much does he have to pay per month?

The total amount John has to pay back is the principal plus the interest, which is $2,500 + ($2,500 x 0.08 x (4/12)) = $2,666.67. Since he has to pay back the same amount every month, he has to pay $2,666.67 / 4 = $666.67 per month.
Samantha borrowed $4,000 for six months at an interest rate of 12%. She has to pay an equal amount every month. How much does she have to pay per month?

The total amount Samantha has to pay back is the principal plus the interest, which is $4,000 + ($4,000 x 0.12 x (6/12)) = $4,480. Since she has to pay back the same amount every month, she has to pay $4,480 / 6 = $746.67 per month.
David borrowed $6,500 for eight months at an interest rate of 15%. He has to pay an equal amount every month. How much does he have to pay per month?

The total amount David has to pay back is the principal plus the interest, which is $6,500 + ($6,500 x 0.15 x (8/12)) = $7,175. Since he has to pay back the same amount every month, he has to pay $7,175 / 8 = $896.88 per month.
Emily borrowed $8,000 for ten months at an interest rate of 18%. She has to pay an equal amount every month. How much does she have to pay per month?

The total amount Emily has to pay back is the principal plus the interest, which is $8,000 + ($8,000 x 0.18 x (10/12)) = $9,400. Since she has to pay back the same amount every month, she has to pay $9,400 / 10 = $940 per month.
Michael borrowed $10,000 for twelve months at an interest rate of 20%. He has to pay an equal amount every month. How much does he have to pay per month?

The total amount Michael has to pay back is the principal plus the interest, which is $10,000 + ($10,000 x 0.20 x (12/12)) = $12,000. Since he has to pay back the same amount every month, he has to pay $12,000 / 12 = $1,000 per month.
Samantha ran 6 kilometers per hour for 4 hours. Rachel ran 8 kilometers per hour and stopped after 3 hours. How many kilometers farther did Samantha run?

To find out how many kilometers farther Samantha ran, we need to calculate the total distance each person ran. Samantha ran 6 km/hour for 4 hours, so she ran a total of 6 x 4 = 24 kilometers. Rachel ran 8 km/hour for 3 hours, so she ran a total of 8 x 3 = 24 kilometers. Since they ran the same distance, Samantha did not run farther than Rachel.

Sarah biked 12 km/hour for 4 hours, so she biked a total of 12 x 4 = 48 kilometers. John biked 60 - 48 = 12 kilometers farther than Sarah.

Jerry walked 6 km/hour for 2 hours, so he walked a total of 6 x 2 = 12 kilometers. Tom walked 15 - 12 = 3 kilometers farther than Jerry.

Samantha wants to make a cake for her friend's birthday. She spends $12 to buy enough ingredients to make 2 cakes. Each cake requires 2 cups of flour. She sells each slice of cake for $2. She sells an average of 3 slices per hour that her cake stand is open. If Samantha sells all of the cake, how much profit will she make per hour that she spends running the cake stand?

Samantha spends $12 to make 2 cakes, so the cost of ingredients for one cake is $6. Each cake requires 2 cups of flour, so Samantha uses 4 cups of flour in total. If she sells all of the cake, she will make $8 per cake (2 cakes x 4 slices per cake x $2 per slice). If she sells an average of 3 slices per hour, she will make $6 per hour (3 slices x $2 per slice). Her profit per hour will be $6 - $6/2 = $3.

Tom wants to sell homemade cookies. He spends $10 to buy enough ingredients to make 2 dozen cookies. Each cookie sells for $0.50. He sells an average of 5 cookies per hour that his cookie stand is open. If Tom sells all of the cookies, how much profit will he make per hour that he spends running the cookie stand?

Tom spends $10 to make 2 dozen cookies, so the cost of ingredients for one cookie is $0.21. If he sells all of the cookies, he will make $12 (2 dozen x 12 cookies per dozen x $0.50 per cookie). If he sells an average of 5 cookies per hour, he will make $2.50 per hour (5 cookies x $0.50 per cookie). His profit per hour will be $2.50 - $0.21 x 5 = $1.39.

John wants to sell fresh-squeezed orange juice. He spends $15 to buy enough oranges to make 2 gallons of juice. Each gallon holds 16 cups of juice. He sells each cup of juice for $1.50. He sells an average of 6 cups per hour that his juice stand is open. If John sells all of the juice, how much profit will he make per hour that he spends running the juice stand?

John spends $15 to make 2 gallons of juice, so the cost of ingredients for one gallon is $7.50. Each gallon holds 16 cups of juice, so John makes 32 cups of juice in total. If he sells all of the juice, he will make $48 (32 cups x $1.50 per cup). If he sells an average of 6 cups per hour, he will make $9 per hour (6 cups x $1.50 per cup). His profit per hour will be $9 - $7.50 = $1.50.

Lena wants to sell homemade muffins. She spends $8 to buy enough ingredients to make 12 muffins. Each muffin sells for $1.25. She sells an average of 4 muffins per hour that her muffin stand is open. If Lena sells all of the muffins, how much profit will she make per hour that she spends running the muffin stand?

Lena spends $8 to make 12 muffins, so the cost of ingredients for one muffin is $0.67. If she sells all of the muffins, she will make $15 (12 muffins x $1.25 per muffin). If she sells an average of 4 muffins per hour, she will make $5 per hour (4 muffins x $1.25 per muffin). Her profit per hour will be $5 - $0.67 x 4 = $2.68.

David wants to sell homemade ice cream. He spends $20 to buy enough ingredients to make 1 gallon of ice cream. Each scoop of ice cream sells for $2. He sells an average of 3 scoops per hour that his ice cream stand is open. If David sells all of the ice cream, how much profit will he make per hour that he spends running the ice cream stand?

David spends $20 to make 1 gallon of ice cream. If he sells all of the ice cream, he will make $32 (16 scoops x $2 per scoop). If he sells an average of 3 scoops per hour, he will make $6 per hour (3 scoops x $2 per scoop). His profit per hour will be $6 - $20/16 x 3 = $2.62.
Mr. Smith sold 4/7 of his land and had 16 hectares left. How much land did he have at first?

Let x be the total land Mr. Smith had at first. Then, he sold 4/7 of his land, which is equal to (4/7)x. Therefore, he had (1-4/7)x = 3/7x hectares left. We know that 3/7x = 16, so x = 37.14 hectares.
Mrs. Johnson sold 2/3 of her land and had 8 hectares left. How much land did she have at first?

Let x be the total land Mrs. Johnson had at first. Then, she sold 2/3 of her land, which is equal to (2/3)x. Therefore, she had (1-2/3)x = 1/3x hectares left. We know that 1/3x = 8, so x = 24 hectares.
Mr. Lee sold 5/8 of his land and had 18 hectares left. How much land did he have at first?
Let x be the total land Mr. Lee had at first. Then, he sold 5/8 of his land, which is equal to (5/8)x. Therefore, he had (1-5/8)x = 3/8x hectares left. We know that 3/8x = 18, so x = 48 hectares.
Mrs. Brown sold 3/4 of her land and had 10 hectares left. How much land did she have at first?

Let x be the total land Mrs. Brown had at first. Then, she sold 3/4 of her land, which is equal to (3/4)x. Therefore, she had (1-3/4)x = 1/4x hectares left. We know that 1/4x = 10, so x = 40 hectares.
Mr. Kim sold 7/9 of his land and had 21 hectares left. How much land did he have at first?
Let x be the total land Mr. Kim had at first. Then, he sold 7/9 of his land, which is equal to (7/9)x. Therefore, he had (1-7/9)x = 2/9x hectares left. We know that 2/9x = 21, so x = 94.5 hectares.
There are 30 students in a class, 60% of whom are girls. If 10 students are absent, how many boys are present in the class?

A company has 80 employees, 40% of whom are part-time workers. If 20% of the full-time workers and 30% of the part-time workers are absent, how many employees are present in the company?

Number of full-time workers = 80 x 60/100 = 48Number of part-time workers = 80 - 48 = 32Number of full-time workers absent = 48 x 20/100 = 9.6 ≈ 10Number of part-time workers absent = 32 x 30/100 = 9.6 ≈ 10Number of employees present = 80 - 10 - 10 = 60
A school has 500 students, 60% of whom are boys. If 20% of the boys and 30% of the girls are absent, how many students are present in the school?

Number of boys in the school = 500 x 60/100 = 300Number of girls in the school = 500 - 300 = 200Number of boys absent = 300 x 20/100 = 60Number of girls absent = 200 x 30/100 = 60Number of students present = 500 - 60 - 60 = 380
A store has 120 employees, 70% of whom are full-time workers. If 10% of the full-time workers and 20% of the part-time workers are absent, how many employees are present in the store?

A hospital has 200 nurses, 80% of whom are women. If 15% of the women and 25% of the men are absent, how many nurses are present in the hospital?

If a student needs an average of 85 or higher to pass a class, and they have received grades of 90, 80, 95, and 87 so far, what grade do they need on their final exam to pass the class?

To find the grade needed on the final exam, we need to first find the current average grade by adding up the grades received so far and dividing by the number of grades. (90+80+95+87)/4 = 88. Then, we can use the formula (current average grade * number of grades + grade needed on final exam) / (number of grades + 1) = passing grade. Plugging in the values, we get (88*4 + x) / 5 = 85. Solving for x, we get x = 83.
A recipe calls for 2 cups of sugar to make 24 cookies. If you want to make 36 cookies, how much sugar do you need?
We can use a proportion to solve this problem. If 2 cups of sugar make 24 cookies, then 1 cup of sugar makes 12 cookies. To make 36 cookies, we need 3 cups of sugar.
A store is having a sale where all items are 20% off. If a shirt originally costs $25, how much will it cost during the sale?

To find the sale price, we need to multiply the original price by the discount percentage (20%) and subtract that amount from the original price. 20% of $25 is $5, so the sale price is $25 - $5 = $20.
A car travels 120 miles in 2 hours. What is its average speed in miles per hour?
To find the average speed, we need to divide the distance traveled by the time it took to travel that distance. 120 miles / 2 hours = 60 miles per hour.
A pizza has 8 slices. If 3 people want to share the pizza equally, how many slices will each person get?

To divide the pizza equally among 3 people, we need to divide the total number of slices by the number of people. 8 slices / 3 people = 2 and 2/3 slices per person. Since we can't have a fraction of a slice, each person will get 2 slices and there will be 2 slices left over.
If a book costs $5 and a pen costs $2, how much do 3 books and 4 pens cost?

To find the total cost, we need to multiply the cost of one book by the number of books and the cost of one pen by the number of pens, and then add the two products. So, 3 books cost 3 x $5 = $15 and 4 pens cost 4 x $2 = $8. Therefore, the total cost is $15 + $8 = $23.
If a shirt costs $12 and a pair of pants costs $20, how much do 5 shirts and 3 pairs of pants cost?

To find the total cost, we need to multiply the cost of one shirt by the number of shirts and the cost of one pair of pants by the number of pants, and then add the two products. So, 5 shirts cost 5 x $12 = $60 and 3 pairs of pants cost 3 x $20 = $60. Therefore, the total cost is $60 + $60 = $120.
If a pizza costs $10 and a soda costs $2, how much do 2 pizzas and 3 sodas cost?

To find the total cost, we need to multiply the cost of one pizza by the number of pizzas and the cost of one soda by the number of sodas, and then add the two products. So, 2 pizzas cost 2 x $10 = $20 and 3 sodas cost 3 x $2 = $6. Therefore, the total cost is $20 + $6 = $26.
If a toy car costs $8 and a toy train costs $12, how much do 4 toy cars and 2 toy trains cost?

To find the total cost, we need to multiply the cost of one toy car by the number of toy cars and the cost of one toy train by the number of toy trains, and then add the two products. So, 4 toy cars cost 4 x $8 = $32 and 2 toy trains cost 2 x $12 = $24. Therefore, the total cost is $32 + $24 = $56.
If a notebook costs $3 and a pen costs $1, how much do 10 notebooks and 5 pens cost?

To find the total cost, we need to multiply the cost of one notebook by the number of notebooks and the cost of one pen by the number of pens, and then add the two products. So, 10 notebooks cost 10 x $3 = $30 and 5 pens cost 5 x $1 = $5. Therefore, the total cost is $30 + $5 = $35.
James delivers 66 messages to Ms. Thompson and 1/3 as many messages to Mr. Yu. If he delivers a total of 99 messages, how many messages did he deliver to Mr. Yu?

Let x be the number of messages James delivers to Mr. Yu. Then, we know that 66 + x/3 = 99. Subtracting 66 from both sides gives x/3 = 33, and multiplying both sides by 3 gives x = 99. Therefore, James delivered 33 messages to Mr. Yu.
James delivers 72 messages to Ms. Johnson and 1/4 as many messages to Mr. Lee. If he delivers a total of 90 messages, how many messages did he deliver to Mr. Lee?

James delivers 80 messages to Ms. Davis and 1/6 as many messages to Mr. Park. If he delivers a total of 90 messages, how many messages did he deliver to Mr. Park?

James delivers 60 messages to Ms. Smith and 1/7 as many messages to Mr. Lee. If he delivers a total of 75 messages, how many messages did he deliver to Mr. Lee?

At the zoo, adult tickets cost $12 and child tickets cost $8. A family of 2 adults and 3 children want to visit the zoo. If they buy individual tickets, how much will they spend?
The cost of 2 adult tickets is $12 x 2 = $24. The cost of 3 child tickets is $8 x 3 = $24. Therefore, the total cost of individual tickets is $24 + $24 = $48.

A pizza restaurant offers a large pizza for $15 and a small pizza for $10. If a group of 4 people want to order pizza and each person wants 2 slices, how many large and small pizzas should they order to minimize cost?

Each large pizza has 8 slices and each small pizza has 6 slices. To get 8 slices for each person, they need 4 large pizzas. To get 2 slices for each person, they need 2 small pizzas. The cost of 4 large pizzas is $15 x 4 = $60. The cost of 2 small pizzas is $10 x 2 = $20. Therefore, they should order 2 small pizzas and 4 large pizzas to minimize cost.
A store sells apples for $0.50 each and oranges for $0.75 each. If a customer wants to buy 5 apples and 3 oranges, how much will they spend?
The cost of 5 apples is $0.50 x 5 = $2.50. The cost of 3 oranges is $0.75 x 3 = $2.25. Therefore, the total cost is $2.50 + $2.25 = $4.75.
A gym charges a monthly fee of $50 and a one-time enrollment fee of $75. If a customer wants to join the gym, how much will they spend in the first month?
The cost of the monthly fee is $50. The cost of the enrollment fee is $75. Therefore, the total cost in the first month is $50 + $75 = $125.
A store offers a 20% discount on all items. If a customer wants to buy a shirt that costs $25 and a pair of pants that costs $40, how much will they spend after the discount?

The cost of the shirt after the discount is $25 - ($25 x 0.20) = $20. The cost of the pants after the discount is $40 - ($40 x 0.20) = $32. Therefore, the total cost after the discount is $20 + $32 = $52.

Samantha is making flower arrangements for a party. She has 8 arrangements to make for the tables and 4 arrangements to make for the buffet. She has 120 inches of ribbon and wants to make a bow for each arrangement with it. How many inches of ribbon can she use for each arrangement bow?

Samantha has a total of 12 arrangements to make. She has 120 inches of ribbon to use for all the bows. The ratio of apples to oranges in a basket is 3:4. If there are 21 fruits in the basket, how many oranges are there?

Let's assume that the ratio of apples to oranges is 3x:4x. Therefore, the total number of fruits in the basket is 3x+4x=7x. We know that the total number of fruits is 21. So, 7x=21. Solving for x, we get x=3. Therefore, the number of oranges in the basket is 4x=4*3=12.
The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 2:3. If there are 25 students in the class, how many boys are there?

Let's assume that the ratio of boys to girls is 2x:3x. Therefore, the total number of students in the class is 2x+3x=5x. We know that the total number of students is 25. So, 5x=25. Solving for x, we get x=5. Therefore, the number of boys in the class is 2x=2*5=10.
The ratio of cats to dogs in a pet store is 4:7. If there are 44 animals in the store, how many cats are there?

Let's assume that the ratio of cats to dogs is 4x:7x. Therefore, the total number of animals in the store is 4x+7x=11x. We know that the total number of animals is 44. So, 11x=44. Solving for x, we get x=4. Therefore, the number of cats in the store is 4x=4*4=16.
The ratio of red balls to blue balls in a bag is 2:5. If there are 35 balls in the bag, how many blue balls are there?

Let's assume that the ratio of red balls to blue balls is 2x:5x. Therefore, the total number of balls in the bag is 2x+5x=7x. We know that the total number of balls is 35. So, 7x=35. Solving for x, we get x=5. Therefore, the number of blue balls in the bag is 5x=5*5=25.
The ratio of pencils to pens in a stationary store is 3:4. If there are 28 writing instruments in the store, how many pens are there?

Let's assume that the ratio of pencils to pens is 3x:4x. Therefore, the total number of writing instruments in the store is 3x+4x=7x. We know that the total number of writing instruments is 28. So, 7x=28. Solving for x, we get x=4. Therefore, the number of pens in the store is 4x=4*4=16.
Samantha wants to buy a new phone. She can either buy it for $800 upfront or pay $50 a month for 18 months. How much money does she save by paying upfront?

To find out how much Samantha saves by paying upfront, we need to calculate the total cost of paying monthly and compare it to the upfront cost. The total cost of paying monthly is $50 x 18 = $900. Therefore, Samantha saves $900 - $800 = $100 by paying upfront.

To find out how much David saves by paying upfront, we need to calculate the total cost of paying monthly and compare it to the upfront cost. The total cost of paying monthly is $50 x 12 = $600. Therefore, David saves $600 - $500 = $100 by paying upfront.
Sarah wants to buy a new dress. She can either buy it for $80 upfront or pay $10 a month for 10 months. How much money does she save by paying upfront?

At John's house, there are three times as many books as pencils. He has a total of 15 pencils in his house. John bought 30 more pencils at the store and 20 fewer books than the number of pencils. Find the combined total of the number of books and pencils John has in the house?

Let's assume the number of pencils John has in his house is x. Then, the number of books he has is 3x. We know that John has 15 pencils, so x = 15. Therefore, the number of books he has is 3(15) = 45. John bought 30 more pencils, so he now has 15 + 30 = 45 pencils. He also bought 20 fewer books than the number of pencils, so he now has 45 - 20 = 25 books. The combined total of the number of books and pencils John has in the house is 45 + 25 = 70.

Samantha is trying to walk 8,000 steps a day. She finished half of her steps on her walks to and from work and did another 1,500 steps going for a short walk during her lunch break. She also went for a short jog around the park and realized that after she had finished her jog, she only had 2,000 steps left to take. How many steps did Samantha take during her jog?

Samantha finished half of her steps on her walks to and from work, which is 8,000/2 = 4,000 steps. She did another 1,500 steps during her lunch break, so she has taken 4,000 + 1,500 = 5,500 steps. Samantha is reading a book that is 60 pages long. It averages 250 words a page. Samantha can read at a rate of 400 words per minute. She has to be at the library in 45 minutes and plans to leave as soon as she finishes the book. It takes 5 minutes to get to the library. How many minutes early will Samantha be?

To find out how long it will take Samantha to finish the book, we need to multiply the number of pages by the number of words per page: 60 pages x 250 words per page = 15,000 words. Then, we can divide the total number of words by Samantha's reading rate: 15,000 words / 400 words per minute = 37.5 minutes. Since Samantha has to be at the library in 45 minutes and it takes 5 minutes to get there, she needs to finish the book in 45 - 5 = 40 minutes. Since it will only take her 37.5 minutes to finish the book, she will be early by 40 - 37.5 = 2.5 minutes.

A company hired 25 employees in January, paying each employee $20 per hour for a 35-hour workweek. In February, they hired 15 more employees and paid them the same rate for a 30-hour workweek. Calculate the total amount of money the company paid to the employees in the two months.

In January, the company paid each employee $20 per hour for a 35-hour workweek, so the total amount paid to each employee is $20 x 35 = $700. Since they hired 25 employees, the total amount paid in January is $700 x 25 = $17,500. In February, the company paid each of the 15 new employees $20 x 30 = $600. The total amount paid in February is $600 x 15 = $9,000. Therefore, the total amount paid to the employees in the two months is $17,500 + $9,000 = $26,500.

A restaurant hired 10 servers in March, paying each server $10 per hour for a 30-hour workweek. In April, they hired 5 more servers and paid them the same rate for a 25-hour workweek. Calculate the total amount of money the restaurant paid to the servers in the two months.

In March, the restaurant paid each server $10 per hour for a 30-hour workweek, so the total amount paid to each server is $10 x 30 = $300. The total amount paid in August is $420 x 20 = $8,400. Therefore, the total amount paid to the employees in the two months is $16,200 + $8,400 = $24,600.

Samantha wants to buy a new laptop. She finds one that costs $800 and another one that costs $1200. She gets a 15% discount on both of them. She also buys a laptop bag that costs $50. How much did she spend in total?

The cost of the first laptop after the discount is 800 - (15/100)*800 = $680. The cost of the second laptop after the discount is 1200 - (15/100)*1200 = $1020. Therefore, the total cost of the laptops is 680 + 1020 = $1700. Adding the cost of the laptop bag, the total cost is 1700 + 50 = $1750.

John wants to buy a new phone. He finds one that costs $500 and another one that costs $700. He gets a 10% discount on both of them. He also buys a phone case that costs $30. How much did he spend in total?

The cost of the first phone after the discount is 500 - (10/100)*500 = $450. The cost of the second phone after the discount is 700 - (10/100)*700 = $630. Therefore, the total cost of the phones is 450 + 630 = $1080. Adding the cost of the phone case, the total cost is 1080 + 30 = $1110.

Samantha went on a road trip. On the first day, she drove 150 miles. On the second day, she drove 20% less than the first day. On the third day, she drove 50% more than the second day. How many miles did Samantha drive in total?

On the second day, Samantha drove 20% less than the first day, which is 0.2 x 150 = 30 miles less. So, she drove 150 - 30 = 120 miles on the second day. The total cost of the items before discount is $800.00 + $100.00 + $50.00 = $950.00. The discount is 10% of $950.00, which is $95.00. So, the final cost is $950.00 - $95.00 = $855.00.

The total cost of the items before discount is $50.00 + $60.00 + $30.00 = $140.00. The discount is 20% of $140.00, which is $28.00. So, the final cost is $140.00 - $28.00 = $112.00.

Let's start by finding out how many dragons Prince Arthur slew. We know that he slew three quarters as many dragons as Prince Thaddeus, who slew 50 dragons. 12 gallons of water were equally divided into 4 different containers. If each container was then divided into 8 equal parts, how many pints of water are in each part?

First, we need to find out how many gallons are in each container. 12 gallons divided by 4 containers equals 3 gallons per container. Then, we need to convert gallons to pints. 1 gallon equals 8 pints, so 3 gallons equals 24 pints. Finally, we divide 24 pints by 8 equal parts to get 3 pints per part.

First, we need to find out how many ounces are in each cup. 20 ounces divided by 4 cups equals 5 ounces per cup. Then, we need to convert ounces to teaspoons. 1 ounce equals 6 teaspoons, so 5 ounces equals 30 teaspoons. Finally, we divide 30 teaspoons by 5 equal parts to get 6 teaspoons per part.

24 cookies were equally divided into 6 different plates. If each plate was then divided into 12 equal parts, how many cookies are in each part?

A store sells pencils for 25 cents and notebooks for $2.50. Sarah spent $10 and got 8 pencils and had 10% of her money left. How many notebooks did she buy?

Let's assume Sarah bought x notebooks. Then, she spent 0.25*8=2 dollars on pencils. So, she spent 10-2=8 dollars on notebooks. We can set up the equation 2.5x+2=8 to find the number of notebooks she bought. Solving for x, we get x=2.

Samantha's lasagna recipe calls for 1 pound of ground beef. She wants to make enough lasagna to serve 8 people and decides to triple the recipe. Ground beef is currently on sale for $3.50 a pound. She also needs 1 box of lasagna noodles that costs $2.00. What is the cost per serving? (Round to the nearest integer.)

Samantha needs 3 pounds of ground beef for her tripled recipe. The cost of the ground beef will be 3 x $3.50 = $10.50. The cost of the lasagna noodles is $2.00. The total cost of the ingredients is $10.50 + $2.00 = $12.50. To find the cost per serving, divide the total cost by the number of servings: $12.50 ÷ 8 = $1.56.

John and Sarah are running a race. John can run 1 mile in 6 minutes, and Sarah can run 1 mile in 8 minutes. If John starts the race 2 minutes before Sarah, how long will it take for Sarah to catch up to John?

Let's assume that the race is n miles long. John can run n miles in 6n minutes, and Sarah can run n miles in 8n minutes. If John starts 2 minutes before Sarah, he will have run 2/6n miles by the time Sarah starts. Therefore, John will have n - 2/6n miles left to run when Sarah starts. Sarah will have to run n miles to catch up to John. Let's set up an equation: 8n = 6n - 2/6n + n - 2/6n. Solving for n, we get n = 1.2 miles. Therefore, Sarah will catch up to John after running 1.2 miles. To find out how long it will take Sarah to run 1.2 miles, we can use her rate: 8 minutes per mile. Therefore, it will take Sarah 9.6 minutes to catch up to John.

Tom and Jerry are driving to a concert. Tom drives at a speed of 60 miles per hour, and Jerry drives at a speed of 70 miles per hour. If Tom leaves 30 minutes before Jerry and the concert is 210 miles away, how long will it take for Jerry to catch up to Tom?

Let's assume that Jerry catches up to Tom after t hours. In that time, Tom will have driven 60t miles, and Jerry will have driven 70(t - 0.5) miles (since Jerry leaves 30 minutes later). We know that the distance between them is 210 miles. Therefore, we can set up an equation: 60t + 70(t - 0.5) = 210. Solving for t, we get t = 2.5 hours. Therefore, it will take Jerry 2 hours to catch up to Tom (since he leaves 30 minutes later). To find out how far Jerry will have driven in 2 hours, we can use his rate: 70 miles per hour. Therefore, Jerry will have driven 140 miles when he catches up to Tom.

Samantha and Emily are swimming laps in a pool. Samantha can swim 1 lap in 2 minutes, and Emily can swim 1 lap in 3 minutes. If Samantha starts swimming 2 minutes before Emily and they both swim for 10 minutes, how many laps will Emily have swum when she catches up to Samantha?

Let's assume that they both swim n laps. In 10 minutes, Samantha will have swum 5n laps, and Emily will have swum 3(n - 1) laps (since she starts 2 minutes later). We know that they will meet when they have swum the same distance. Therefore, we can set up an equation: 5n = 3(n - 1) + n. Solving for n, we get n = 1.5 laps. Therefore, Emily will have swum 1 lap and 0.5 laps (half a lap) when she catches up to Samantha. To find out how long it takes Emily to swim half a lap, we can use her rate: 3 minutes per lap. Therefore, it will take Emily 1.5 minutes to swim half a lap.

Amanda and Brian are baking cakes. Amanda can bake a cake in 45 minutes, and Brian can bake a cake in 60 minutes. If Amanda starts baking 10 minutes before Brian and they both bake for 2 hours, how many cakes will Brian have baked when he catches up to Amanda?

Let's assume that they both bake n cakes. In 2 hours, Amanda will have baked 4n/3 cakes, and Brian will have baked 2n/3 cakes (since he starts 10 minutes later). We know that they will meet when they have baked the same number of cakes. Therefore, we can set up an equation: 4n/3 = 2n/3 + n. Solving for n, we get n = 3 cakes. Therefore, Brian will have baked 2 cakes when he catches up to Amanda.

David and Lisa are walking to a store. David walks at a speed of 4 miles per hour, and Lisa walks at a speed of 3 miles per hour. If David starts walking 20 minutes before Lisa and the store is 2 miles away, how long will it take for Lisa to catch up to David?

Let's assume that Lisa catches up to David after t hours. In that time, David will have walked 4t miles, and Lisa will have walked 3(t - 1/3) miles (since Lisa starts 20 minutes later). We know that the distance between them is 2 miles. Therefore, we can set up an equation: 4t - 3(t - 1/3) = 2. Solving for t, we get t = 1 hour. Therefore, it will take Lisa 40 minutes to catch up to David (since she starts 20 minutes later). To find out how far Lisa will have walked when she catches up to David, we can use her rate: 3 miles per hour. Therefore, Lisa will have walked 2.5 miles when she catches up to David.
The area of a rectangular garden is 240 square feet. If the width of the garden is 8 feet, what is the length of the garden in feet?
Let the length of the garden be L. We know that the area of the garden is the product of its length and width, so we have L x 8 = 240. Solving for L, we get L = 30.
The area of a rectangular field is 450 square meters. If the length of the field is 15 meters, what is the width of the field in meters?
Let the width of the field be W. We know that the area of the field is the product of its length and width, so we have 15 x W = 450. Solving for W, we get W = 30.

When Sarah wakes up, her house is 35 degrees. She spends 2 hours cooking, and every hour the stove is on it raises the house's temperature by 4 degrees. Then Sarah opens a window for 20 minutes, and the house cools down 1 degree for every 5 minutes the window is open. What is the house's final temperature?

After 2 hours of cooking, the temperature of the house would have increased by 8 degrees (4 degrees per hour x 2 hours). So, the temperature of the house would be 43 degrees (35 degrees + 8 degrees). Samantha runs a marathon. It takes her 2 hours and 30 minutes for the first half and 2 hours and 45 minutes for the second half. A store owner bought a case of 36 t-shirts for $432. He sold 12 of them for $15 at a clearance sale on Monday, and the rest were sold to a customer for $20 each throughout the rest of the week. How much money, in dollars, was the store owner's profit?
